text: Pepinia hooveri is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador, where it grows in coastal and mountain forest habitat. There are four known subpopulations, none of which is in a protected area.Manzanares, J.M. & Pitman, N. 2003. Pepinia hooveri. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2003.
